p: This strategy is attractive because it is highly visible and conveys the message that health authorities use vector-control activities [ 78]. The risks to humans due to the management of adult mosquitoes are probably negligible [ 79]. This has no direct impact on immature stages (egg, larvae, or pupae) [ 80], targeting adult mosquitoes only, and is performed by spraying small droplets of insecticide into the air. It is used mainly in emergency situations to limit the massive production of adult mosquitoes, thus decreasing the risk of existing outbreaks expanding [ 78].
